intro: Pyrus communis var. dispar, commonly known as the common pear with variable form, is a variant of the European pear. It is characterized by its variable leaf shape and fruit size, which can range from small to medium. The plant typically grows as a deciduous tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a serrated margin. The flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and the fruit is a梨-shaped pome with a thin skin and sweet, juicy flesh.
